exclusion:
1. Start Z-Wave inclusion.
  2. Quickly press the Z-Wave button 3 times.
inclusion:
1. Start Z-Wave inclusion.
  2. Quickly press the Z-Wave button 3 times.

The LED indicator will blink to signal communication and remain on for 2 seconds to confirm inclusion.
label: ZEN17
overview:
Features

  • Powerful dry contact NO/NC relays to control loads up to 20 A for NO
  • Perfect for DC motors, pumps, commercial gates, or HVAC equipment
  • Control up to 2 connected loads independently or together
  • Z-Wave or optional wall switch control (toggle or momentary type)
  • Monitor inpuits independently from output control
  • Built-in timers for each relay to simplify automation
  • Built-in Z-Wave Plus signal repeater to extend network range
  • Powered by 12-24 V DC/AC or USB C port for easy set-up
  • Wall mounting and minimal design for clean installation
  • New 700 Z-Wave chip, S2 security, and SmartStart

Specifications

  • Model Number: ZEN17
  • Z-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz
  • Power: 12-24 V DC/AC or USB C (DON'T use laptop/tablet chargers)
  • Maximum Load: NO relays: 20 A, NC relays: 10 A
  • Range: Up to 200 feet line of sight
  • Operating Temperature: 32-104° F (0-40° C)
  • Installation and Use: Indoor only
usage: If your primary controller is missing or inoperable, you may need to reset the device to factory settings. To complete the reset process manually, click the Z-Wave button 4 times quickly, the LED indicator will light up, then quickly click the Z-Wave button 4 times again. The LED indicator will flash 3 times to confirm successful rest and will then turn off. Note: all previously recorded activity and custom settings will be erased from the device's memory.

parameters.label: On Off Status After Power Failure
parameters.description: Set the on off status for the relays after power failure

options.label: Relay 1 restores on/off status, Relay 2 ON
Relay 2 restores on/off status, Relay 1 ON

parameters.label: Input Type for Relay 1 (S1)
parameters.description: Choose the wall switch or input type you want to connect to the S1 C terminals
parameters.overview: Press and hold the Z-Wave button for 5 seconds to change to garage mode manually. IMPORTANT: If you set this parameter to value 4-10, you'll need to exclude and re-include the device (without changing any settings) so that a child device is created for the input of your choice!

options.label: Toggle switch (light on when up, off when down)
Toggle switch (state changes whenever the switch is toggled; default)

parameters.label: Input Type for Relay 2 (S2)
parameters.description: Choose the wall switch or input type you want to connect to the S2 C terminals
parameters.overview: Press and hold the Z-Wave button for 5 seconds to change to garage mode manually. IMPORTANT: If you set this parameter to value 4-10, you'll need to exclude and re-include the device (without changing any settings) so that a child device is created for the input of your choice!

options.label: Toggle switch (light on when up, off when down)
Toggle switch (state changes whenever the switch is toggled; default)

parameters.label: LED Indicator Control
parameters.overview:
Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when any of the relays are on or if all of them are off, or if you want it to remain on or off at all times.

Click the Z-Wave button 5 times quickly to change mode manually.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer for Relay 1
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to Relay 1 to automatically turn off once it has been turned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer for Relay 1
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to Relay 1 to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer for Relay 2
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to Relay 2 to automatically turn off once it has been turned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer for Relay 2
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to Relay 2 to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Input Trigger for Relay 1
parameters.overview: Choose if you'd like the connected input (switch) on S1 C/VC C to trigger the load connected to R1 or if you want to use the input reports for monitoring only and separate the output from the input.

parameters.label: Input Trigger for Relay 2
parameters.overview: Choose if you'd like the connected input (switch) on S2 C/VC C to trigger the load connected to R2 or if you want to use the input reports for monitoring only and separate the output from the input.

parameters.label: Auto Timer-Off Timer Unit for Relay 1
parameters.description: Use this parameter to choose between seconds, minutes, or hours to be used as the auto timer-off unit for Relay 1

parameters.label: Auto Timer-On Timer Unit for Relay 1
parameters.description: Use this parameter to choose between seconds, minutes, or hours to be used as the auto timer-on unit for Relay 1

parameters.label: Auto Timer-Off Timer Unit for Relay 2
parameters.description: Use this parameter to choose between seconds, minutes, or hours to be used as the auto timer-off unit for Relay 2

parameters.label: Auto Timer-On Timer Unit for Relay 2
parameters.description: Use this parameter to choose between seconds, minutes, or hours to be used as the auto timer-on unit for Relay 2

parameters.label: DC Motor Mode
parameters.description: Sync Relay 1 and Relay 2 together to prevent them from being activated at the same time

options.label: DC motor mode disabled (relays will activate whenever triggered)
DC motor mode enabled (relay checks the status of the other relay)

associations.label: Relay 1
associations.description: Send BASIC_SET reports when operated manually

associations.label: Relay 2
associations.description: Send BASIC_SET reports when operated manually
